body: Makes sense. Will add it to the list of features. Thanks for requesting it.
I would like to work on this feature. @w4nderlust , can I? Thanks in advance!
I noticed, that this massage was not intended for me... lets see what @w4nderlust says.

@lordeddard yes sure.
Let me give you some instructions:
you should add some code in `numerical_feature.py`. In particular in the base feature you can add a `normalization_strategy` preprocessing parameter. The default value is `None`, the optional value is `zscore` and maybe also `minmax`.
In `get_feature_meta` if the `normalization_strategy` in preprocessing is `zscore` you compute mean and standard deviation of the column and return those values inside the return dictionary (they will be saved in the metadata json files). If `minmax` then you will collect minimum and maximum.
in `add_feature_data` if the `normalization_strategy` in preprocessing is `zscore` you can obtain mean and standard deviation from the metadata and use them to normalize the data column, something similar for `minmax`.
It should be pretty straightforward.
Once you are done, please write a testcase to make sure it works.
Finally don't forget to update the documentation, in particular `mkdocs/docs/user_guide.md`.
Let me know if something is not clear or if you need support,
Thanks for the instructions. I’ll start working on this.
@lordeddard thank you for working on this!

issue.title: Add Normalization Strategies
issue.body:
# Pull Request

 This Pull Request does these things. 

- Incorporates two normalization strategies - 'zscore' and 'minmax'.
- Refereces - #296.

issue.title: Added normalization strategies for numerical types
issue.body:
# Pull Request

 This PR does these things. 
- Refereces - #296.
- Incorporates two normalization strategies - 'zscore' and 'minmax'.

TODO:
- Will update the user guide after getting some instructions on next steps.

body: @lordeddard added this functionality, thanks so much! Now the user can normalize with zscore, normalize with minmax and not normalize at all. If people want to add additional normalization strategies, if would be pretty straightworward, so feel free to contribute.
